nodes.bodyText: This change is curious. The setInfluxDatabase method accepts null, so this value should also be nullable. Should you change the setter as well? Or is there something else going on?

I removed those nullable as it was expecting these fields non-null here via, this. I removed the Nullable from here thinking of it as a test code and InfluxDBSettings.java as a non-test code.
Annotating the corresponding fields at InfluxDBSettings.java as Nullable also should work.
Should I go with that?
Ah that makes sense. What you should do, I think, is alter setInfluxDatabase so the parameter is non-nullable. Otherwise somehow the pipeline options would be magically turning null into non-null.
So these three getters (for measurements, host and database) are fine, and we should also change these three setters to take non-null arguments. Correct me if I am wrong.
Yes, exactly. I wonder if we can alter the core PipelineOptions code that generates the proxy objects to ensure that the nullability matches... (if you want an extra fun follow up project...)
